standard_metadata.standard_description: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change  and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (x, y) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph. Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $5$ | $6$ | $7$ | $8$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-3$ | $-1$ | $1$ | $3$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &5 &6 &7 &8 \\ \hline \\ y &-3 &-1 &1 &3 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+2]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+2]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+2]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{2}{1}=2$
The slope is $2$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $-4$ | $-3$ | $-2$ | $-1$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $2$ | $5$ | $8$ | $11$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &-4 &-3 &-2 &-1 \\ \hline \\ y &2 &5 &8 &11 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+3]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+3]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+3]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{3}{1}=3$
The slope is $3$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $12$ | $13$ | $14$ | $15$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-4$ | $2$ | $8$ | $14$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &12 &13 &14 &15 \\ \hline \\ y &-4 &2 &8 &14 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+6]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+6]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+6]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{6}{1}=6$
The slope is $6$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $-1$ | $0$ | $1$ | $2$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $10$ | $18$ | $26$ | $34$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &-1 &0 &1 &2 \\ \hline \\ y &10 &18 &26 &34 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+8]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+8]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+8]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{8}{1}=8$
The slope is $8$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $5$ | $6$ | $7$ | $8$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-5$ | $-6$ | $-7$ | $-8$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &5 &6 &7 &8 \\ \hline \\ y &-5 &-6 &-7 &-8 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-1]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-1]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-1]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-1}{1}=-1$
The slope is $-1$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $-7$ | $-6$ | $-5$ | $-4$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $21$ | $17$ | $13$ | $9$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &-7 &-6 &-5 &-4 \\ \hline \\ y &21 &17 &13 &9 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-4]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-4]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-4]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-4}{1}=-4$
The slope is $-4$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $13$ | $14$ | $15$ | $16$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $11$ | $6$ | $1$ | $-4$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &13 &14 &15 &16 \\ \hline \\ y &11 &6 &1 &-4 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-5]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-5]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-5]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-5}{1}=-5$
The slope is $-5$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $39$ | $40$ | $41$ | $42$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $36$ | $29$ | $22$ | $15$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+1}\,\,\,\, \\ x &39 &40 &41 &42 \\ \hline \\ y &36 &29 &22 &15 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-7]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-7]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-7]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-7}{1}=-7$
The slope is $-7$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $-4$ | $1$ | $6$ | $11$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-3$ | $-2$ | $-1$ | $0$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+5}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+5}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+5}\,\,\,\, \\ x &-4 &1 &6 &11 \\ \hline \\ y &-3 &-2 &-1 &0 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+1]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+1]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+1]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{1}{5}$
The slope is $\dfrac15$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $9$ | $13$ | $17$ | $21$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-24$ | $-21$ | $-18$ | $-15$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+4}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+4}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+4}\,\,\,\, \\ x &9 &13 &17 &21 \\ \hline \\ y &-24 &-21 &-18 &-15 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+3]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+3]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+3]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{3}{4}$
The slope is $\dfrac34$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $15$ | $17$ | $19$ | $21$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-10$ | $2$ | $14$ | $26$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+2}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+2}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+2}\,\,\,\, \\ x &15 &17 &19 &21 \\ \hline \\ y &-10 &2 &14 &26 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+12]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+12]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+12]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{12}{2}=6$
The slope is $6$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $-7$ | $-4$ | $-1$ | $2$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $-7$ | $14$ | $35$ | $56$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+3}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+3}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+3}\,\,\,\, \\ x &-7 &-4 &-1 &2 \\ \hline \\ y &-7 &14 &35 &56 \\ &&\xrightarrow[+21]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+21]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[+21]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{21}{3}=7$
The slope is $7$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $-1$ | $1$ | $3$ | $5$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $10$ | $2$ | $-6$ | $-14$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+2}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+2}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+2}\,\,\,\, \\ x &-1 &1 &3 &5 \\ \hline \\ y &10 &2 &-6 &-14 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-8]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-8]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-8]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-8}{2}=-4$
The slope is $-4$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $31$ | $36$ | $41$ | $46$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $10$ | $8$ | $6$ | $4$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+5}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+5}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+5}\,\,\,\, \\ x &31 &36 &41 &46 \\ \hline \\ y &10 &8 &6 &4 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-2]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-2]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-2]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-2}{5}=-\dfrac25$
The slope is $-\dfrac25$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $45$ | $49$ | $53$ | $57$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $10$ | $5$ | $0$ | $-5$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+4}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+4}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+4}\,\,\,\, \\ x &45 &49 &53 &57 \\ \hline \\ y &10 &5 &0 &-5 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-5]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-5]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-5]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-5}{4}=-\dfrac54$
The slope is $-\dfrac54$.

question.content: **What is the slope of the line that contains these points?**  $x$ | $8$ | $11$ | $14$ | $17$ -: | -: | -: | -: | -: $y$ | $36$ | $12$ | $-12$ | $-36$  slope:

hints.content: $\text{Slope}=\dfrac{\text{Rise}}{\text{Run}}=\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}$  We can calculate the change in $x$ and change in $y$ by picking any two pairs of corresponding $x$- and $y$-values.

$\begin{array}{lrrrr} &&\xrightarrow{+3}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+3}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow{+3}\,\,\,\, \\ x &8 &11 &14 &17 \\ \hline \\ y &36 &12 &-12 &-36 \\ &&\xrightarrow[-24]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-24]{}\,\,\,\, &\xrightarrow[-24]{}\,\,\,\, \end{array}$  So the slope is:  $\dfrac{\text{Change in }y}{\text{Change in }x}=\dfrac{-24}{3}=-8$
The slope is $-8$.
